body.name: The Teacher's Hidden Scars: A Historical Western Romance Novel

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars RUMORS TRAVEL FASTER THAN TRUTH
reviews.reviewText: A new beginning! Lily had a cruel father, eventually she ran away to find herself a job in Jordan, Nevada as their schoolteacher, although her history hinders her development of friendships.Meanwhile, Tucker rode his horse, Bailey, to Jordan and Lily is the first person he meets there. Tucker has been running from his father’s old enemies who claimed that his debt fell to Tucker.Lily has only two real friends in Jordan the town’s medical doctor, Dr Thomas, and the town’s baker, Clara, that do not view only the surface scars. Lily seems to have emotionally triggered asthma, but medical information about this disorder is limited at that time that many accused Lily. When people do not understand, they become fearful.Tucker became interested in Lily the first time he met her. Their connection became stronger, until she found mysterious notes about Tucker and heard rumors within Jordan accusing him of a string of criminal activity. Lily’s assurance of Tucker is severely shaken.Clara’s statement to Lily from Dr Thornton Thomas “To always remember lies spread faster while the truth is still tying its boots.” Rumors do travel faster than truth. Must read story to learn all the details of who was behind the rumors, how Tucker and Lily were connected in their past, and able to find their present happiness.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Actions Speak Louder Than Gossip
reviews.reviewText: A well-written western about two individuals who come from troubled pasts. Lily is a schoolteacher who has no family and few friends. She has a facial disfigurement that makes people look at her with disdain or avoid her altogether. She meets Tucker, a new cowboy in town, who also bears scars that are physical (that no one can see) and emotional (that makes trusting and getting close to others difficult). Tucker thinks Lily is beautiful, despite her scars. He loves the way she opens up with the children she is teaching and cares about their needs. Lily finds that she feels safe around Tucker and he has volunteered to help patch the old school house before winter sets in. As they spend more time together, they find that they enjoy each other's company. Unfortunately, neither know that their pasts are about to catch up with them and put them on a collision course to find out if the trust and love that's developing is strong enough to withstand horrible revelations and violence. This story is about friendship, love and trust. I definitely recommend this book.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Two scarred people, can they help each other?
reviews.reviewText: Lily has scars on the outside, and Tucker has scars on the inside. They have opportunity to help each other and build something real. This is a tangled and twisted story that will touch your heart. Read it to find out how this wonderful love story turns out.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Tucker and Lily - two scarred souls - inside and out
reviews.reviewText: Lily is a school teacher searching for a place to call home. Her family's response to her scars has added stress which contributes to other physical manifestations beyond her scars. She has left her family to begin her life anew. Much of the story is the glimmers of what might have transpired in her life that causes so much fear and strife for Lily. She is a sweet soul that treats others with such kindness. It takes a long time to learn all about her external scars.When Tucker comes to town, there is immediate attraction between them and a sense of sympathy since he has scars as well. Both are slow to share their full story and slow to trust anyone. As the story progresses, there are rumors that fly about Tucker which makes it even harder for Lily to trust but she never fully breaks her trust in him. Great story with a bit of twist concerning Lily and Tucker.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2024
reviews.reviewText: An interesting storyline, but way too much emphasis on Lilys' facial scar.I am sure more than a FEW folks back then had : scars, missing limbs due to accidents, gunshots, etc.The town folks were cruel to chastise her so badly.Story was also drawn out a bit. Unnecessary descriptions to add page count.I did receive an ARC copy; but this is my honest opinion.Lots of pages, great price, just not worth Hours of melodrama.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 12, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I really loved reading this story. I loved how Tucker was able to see past Lily's scars to see her true beauty. This really is a very good and exciting story. I really did enjoy reading it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This is a wonderful story of love and intrigue. Tucker and Lily both have scars in their past and no idea how those parts inter-twine…. But the scars create an incredible empathy that only someone who knows can have….

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Lorelei Brogan has written an outstanding western store. The characters are well written and you feel like they are with you. Exciting book that you can’t put down. A must read for lovers of western stories!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on February 2, 2024
